projects.heading: Understanding the Working of the Next.js Framework and React UI Library
projects.introContent: My understanding of the frontend development process, particularly with React, and how it integrates with the Next.js framework.

projects.heading: Understanding the Components of Software Systems
projects.introContent: My compilation of the study of typical components of distributed software systems. I will keep it updated with all my insights.

projects.heading: Understanding Event Loop-Driven Architectures
projects.introContent: Implemented event loops in both Go and Python to gain insights into how they work.

projects.heading: Understanding Different Programming Languages
projects.introContent: This article contains my understanding of programming languages and a comparison of different features found in each of them. This is an ongoing study, and I continue to update it with any new findings.

projects.heading: Implementation of Git
projects.introContent: Implemented Git interface and plumbing commands to clone a repository from the remote.

projects.heading: Implementation of an HTTP Web Server
projects.introContent: Implemented a basic HTTP server that can accept HTTP requests and send appropriate responses.

projects.heading: Implementation of SQLite
projects.introContent: Implemented a version that can read SQLite database files and execute basic SQL queries like SELECT, WHERE, etc., using indexes.

projects.heading: Implementation of Redis
projects.introContent: Implemented an event loop-based Redis server that can parse and read RDB files, read, write, and replicate in-memory storage, and support Redis streams and transactions.

projects.heading: Implementation of the Chord Protocol-Based Distributed Hash Table for Peer-to-Peer Networks
projects.introContent: Implemented a scalable key-value store using the Chord Protocol for decentralized networks. The Chord Protocol simplifies key lookup, node joining, and leaving processes, ensuring consistent behavior. Conducted performance evaluations on fetch times by increasing the key count from 100K to 1.6M on a system with 100 nodes.

projects.heading: Implementation of the Raft Consensus Algorithm for Distributed Systems
projects.introContent: Implemented a replicated state machine using Raft, a distributed consensus protocol, to ensure log consistency across replicas in the system. Implemented log replication and leader election to handle node failures and validated it using rigorous testing with simulated node failures.

projects.heading: Optimization and Implementation of Parallelized Graph Algorithms for Shared Memory Architectures
projects.introContent: Implemented a framework for parallel graph algorithms on shared memory machines using OpenMP. Optimized the data access pattern, avoiding race conditions, to achieve a speedup of 8x for Bellman-Ford, 7x for Connected Components, and 3x for Breadth-First Search algorithms on a graph with 1 million vertices and 15 million edges.

projects.heading: Analysis and Modeling of Quantitative Financial Data from Equity Markets
projects.introContent: Analyzed trades and quotes data for S&P 500 companies from June 2007 to September 2007 for modeling market impact. Estimated the predictive parameters and conducted statistical hypothesis tests to validate the model's performance.

projects.heading: Semantic image segmentation of satellite images using U-Net CNN architectures
projects.introContent: Experimented with various U-Net models using different encoders to segment satellite images in the Landcover.ai dataset.

projects.heading: Implementation and analysis of various Monte Carlo sampling algorithms
projects.introContent: Developed parallel algorithms in Python to implement Monte Carlo sampling techniques for estimating statistical quantities. These algorithms included importance sampling, ensemble methods, MCMC schemes, Langevin dynamics, and more.

projects.heading: Experimentation with Incorporating Causal Inference in Recommendation Systems
projects.introContent: Experimented with capturing causal relationships between user actions and recommended items using probabilistic latent factor models, and used that inference to build recommendation systems.

projects.heading: 2D graphics interactive editor
projects.introContent: Developed a desktop application featuring a custom rasterization pipeline for real-time, responsive manipulation of 2D graphics (triangles).

roles.roleHeading: 3DExperience SOLIDWORKS Drafting & MBD Software Engineering Manager
roleDesc: Developing a full-stack web application for technical drawings and 3D annotations of CAD models, enabling engineers to transition from traditional 2D blueprints to digital design workflows.
Building a highly interactive UI with an Angular frontend, and a high-performance C++ backend, and utilizing WebGL and Three.js for real-time 3D rendering.
Tech Stack: C++ 20, JavaScript, TypeScript, Three.js, WebGL, Docker, Git, GitLab, Jenkins, Jasmine
Designed and optimized geometric computation algorithms to enhance fluid dynamics performance in computational fluid dynamics (CFD) workflows.
Developed tools for detecting conformal contacts and transforming non-conformal contacts into conformal ones, enabling better handling of complex CAD geometries.
Improved mesh quality by designing offsetting algorithms for CAD assemblies and refining outputs from Boolean operations.
Reduced processing time by 75% through multithreading-based parallelization techniques and algorithm optimizations.
Developed native simulation software features for Linux and Windows using C++ (backend) and Qt (frontend).
Technologies and Tools: C++, Qt, SVN, Computational Geometry
Developed surface modeling and mesh processing algorithms for proximity detection, connection establishment, and mesh editing, enabling accurate simulation of welds, rivets, and fasteners.
Designed and implemented robust algorithms to compare meshes of two CAD models for regression testing based on key geometric parameters.
Enhanced mesh preprocessing workflows by optimizing algorithms for structural analysis and manufacturing simulations.
Technologies and Tools: C++, Perforce, Jenkins

masters.name: New York Univeristy
student jobs: Grader for Modeling and Simulation in Science, Engineering and Economics
